body.p:
Vancburg Ky. Oct. 15, 1863.
Hon. H. Taylor
Maysville Ky,
My Dear Sir,

I see from the Maysville Eagle of this week that Genl. John Boyle desires Some two persons in Each county recommended for Col. & Luty. Col. to organize a force for State defence under the State guard law.

I would be glad & so would all conservative men in Lewis if you would have Liutenant A. J. Farrow (late of the 10th) appointed Col. & Elias D. Secrest, appointed Lieut. Col. for that purpose both have Served with credit to themselves in the 10th Farrow was 1st Liutenant in Milt. Evans Com. & both are in favor of putting down the rebelion as well as the freebooters & robers-
& I can tell you that all of our Union men are not in favor of punishing the robers that infest our county, for if they (the leading Union Men) had discountenanced it from the Start, we would not of had half the trouble we have had The conservative Union Men have always agreed with you, Wadsworth Gov. Bramlet & other loyal men, & we ask you to Step up & help us get a good man appointed now, as the radicals will get one of their number appointed if they can, write to the Gov. & Genl Boyle immediately. Secrest lives at Concord & Farrow at Poplar Flat. P. O. Excuse us for Troubling you so much-
